COMMENT_TX: $Alfredo Amezaga called for interference
ej,presj001,C,davib902,Balls and strikes Marlins Batting Coach Jim Presley ejected by HP umpire Bob Davidson
Astros pitcher Wandy Rodriguez left the game due to a sore groin

ej,coopc001,M,reedr901,Catch/no catch call $Ryan Spilborghs made a diving catch moving away from the plate; the ball appeared to bounce out of the glove; Spilborghs held the ball up in his bare hand and 2B umpire Mark Wegner ruled it a catch; Houston manager Cecil Cooper came out to protest the call; the umpires huddled and let the call stand; Cooper was ejected by HP umpire Rick Reed
fan interference

$Soto hit the ball off the LCF wall and it bounced away from the fielders; the ball hit in the out of play area and should have been ruled a homer and not in play; 2B umpire Joe West later said he lost sight of the ball and ruled it in play; it hit above and to the right of the L-shaped line on the left centerfield wall
Phillies Jayson Werth left the game due to an injured chest

$HP umpire Jerry Crawford was struck by Carlos Lee's bat on the follow through of the swing on the sixth pitch to Lee; Crawford left the game with a bloody gash on the left side of his head; he was taken to the hospital for tests but did not require stitches and was back at the park before the end of the game; there was a 12-minute delay while Rob Drake changed his gear and went behind the plate umpchange,1,umphome,drakr901 umpchange,1,ump1b,nauep901 umpchange,1,ump2b,(None)
Debut game for Mitchell Boggs
Cardinals pitcher Adam Wainwright left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
fan interference
ej,ausmb001,P,campa902,Checked swing $Astros catcher Brad Ausmus ejected by 1B umpire Angel Campos for arguing a check swing call for ball three

ej,coopc001,M,campa902,Safe call on pickoff at 1B $Lance Berkman argued a safe call on the third pickoff attempt at 1B; Astros manager Cecil Cooper came out to argue and was ejected by 1B umpire Angel Campos; Cooper threw his hat to the ground at Campos' feet
originally S4, changed on 6-26 to 4E3
originally scored 4E6, changed after game, changed back again next day
Yankees pitcher Chien-Ming Wang left the game due to a sprained right foot; he injured it running the bases on Jeter's hit. Out for minimum of six weeks
Rangers center fielder Josh Hamilton left the game due to an injured knee
$Hamilton was hit on the hand
Rangers center fielder Josh Hamilton left the game due to an injured hand
Debut game for Chris Davis
$Quintero hit in head by Maza's bat. Delay of 3:58; onto DL with concussion

ej,brocd001,P,timmt901,Outburst on mound after a walk $Astros pitcher Doug Brocail yelled an expletive at himself and pounded his glove after the walk to Matt Kemp; HP umpire Tim Timmons thought the outburst was directed at him and ejected Brocail
fan interference
$Debut for umpire Delfin Colon
Debut game for Dan Murphy

$Geoff Blum hit a sinking liner that Dan Murphy trapped; Hunter Pence started running from 2B immediately on the hit while Mark Loretta waited at 3B and then stumbled when he started towards HP; Pence nearly passed Loretta half way home; they both slid into the plate with Loretta knocking catcher Ramon Castro off the plate; Pence slid in immediately after Loretta; plate umpire Tim Welke signaled 'safe' and then 'safe'
Debut game for Eddie Kunz
Astros second baseman Kazuo Matsui left the game due to an injured back
Giants pitcher Tim Lincecum left the game due to an injured knee
Debut game for Ryan Rohlinger
Debut game for Pablo Sandoval
Giants center fielder Aaron Rowand left the game due to an injured back

ej,coopc001,M,wintm901,Arguing catch/trap call $Cardinal center fielder Skip Schumaker dove for Humberto Quintero's liner and bounced up quickly to make a throw; the ball was ruled a catch by 2B umpire Marvin Hudson but it appeared to be a trap; Astros manager Cecil Cooper argued the call and was ejected by 1B umpire Mike Winters

ej,larut101,M,wintm901,Balls and strikes $Astros pitcher Wandy Rodriguez left the game due to an injured back; Cardinals Manager Tony La Russa ejected by HP umpire Mike Winters for arguing balls and strikes
$The last two plays are really one continuous play; pitcher Alberto Arias made a wild throw on a pick-off attempt and Nyjer Morgan nearly scored on the play
Debut game for Mark Saccomanno $Mark Saccomanno hit the first major league pitch he saw for a homer
$Luis Cruz called for interference
Pirates second baseman Freddy Sanchez left the game due to an injured head

replay,6,pench001,HOU,welkt901,HOU03,O,N,I,,H $the ball struck the top of the wall and was called in play; crew chief Tim welke watched the replay and upheld the call; this was the second usage of the replay system
Pirates pitcher Tom Gorzelanny left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
$Game played at Miller Park, Milwaukee, due to the effects of Hurricane Ike in Houston; the game was scheduled for 9/12
$First no-hitter for the Cubs since 1972
$Game played at Miller Park, Milwaukee, due to the effects of Hurricane Ike in Houston; the game was scheduled for 9/13
$Originally ruled E7, changed two days later. Not only does this give Votto a triple and 2 RBI, it also changes two runs from unearned to earned

replay,7,vottj001,CIN,darlg901,HOU03,O,N,I,,H $Votto's fly ball struck the top of the wall on the yellow line and bounced back onto the field; the Reds argued that it was over the fence into the seats instead of off the wall; after an on-field discussion, crew chief Gary Darling watched the replay and upheld the call; the process took six minutes; this was the fourth usage of the replay system
Astros pitcher Chris Sampson left the game due to an injured elbow
$No DP due to intervening error
